chapter.title: Working with Containers
chapter.para: After you have created your images, you can start your containers based on that image. You can run an instance of the image by using the docker run command. Docker Open Source Engine then creates and starts the container. The command docker run takes several arguments:

listitem.para: A container name. (Giving containers individual names is recommended.)
Specify a user to use in your container.
Specify a particular host name, etc.
